A policy is a document that regulates employee’s job functions. 
The topic involves multiple combined policies.
With the editor opened, you may use it for inserting any text, creating tables, and adding photos and videos:
Type the policy. You may insert photos and videos, create tables, lists, add usable links and use the text editor functions in full.
Select a user to be authorized to access the policy. To do this, click “Access”.
Select every user who needs this policy for his/her job guidance.
Select the user-accessible functions displayed on the left of the screen;
You may select the following options displayed on the right of the screen:
a policy will be accessible to all users of the Tonnus system;
– a policy will be accessible to all users assigned to the role of “manager”;
– a policy will be accessible only to those users who are assigned to the role of “performer”.

Then click “Save”. In the next pop-up window, you may select the users who are not authorized to have access to the policy. 
For example, you create a policy “Employee corporate training guide”. As for a sales department, employees shall be trained independently according to specific internal rules and training programs. In this case, select the option that provides access to the policy for all users and click
Similarly, select the options to reject authorization for the users concerned and click “Save”.
Your policy is ready. You may click the “save” button or “add test”. We recommend adding a small test to each policy.
You may create your own test in order to ensure efficient policy training! Click on the “Add test” button when creating a policy.
Type your question and add multiple choice answers.
Click on the plus to add more answer choices.
Сlick “Request publication” to publish the policy and select the option to assign a manager who will approve the created document.
After that, the policy will be sent for approval to the user authorized. On approval, the policy will be sent to the assigned users for training.
You may leave your comments under each policy, publish your results, and ask any question. Additionally, you may put a reaction to any written comment.
Click on the pencil icon to correct the policy, if required.
On opening the policy editing window, you may enter any changes.

You should note that you may send the policy, if any significant changes are made, to all the assigned users for re-training. If you enable this option, the employees will need to review the policy and pass the test.
Then the policy is sent for approval. On approval, it is sent for training.
You may also add the policy to the created topic. The detailed information is described below.

Policy control bar


- All policies are subject to check, approval or rejection. To do these actions, go to the “For approval” section. If a policy is written correctly, click “Publish”.
- All policies are subject to training and, testing; go to the  “To learn” section.
- All policies created by you are displayed in section “My”. The actual “Published” or “In progress” status may be reflected next to each policy.
will show all the policies available in the company.
Click the "Topics" tab to view the available sections with each training rating displayed next to them.
The “Unfinished” Section shows all unpublished policies displayed as those that are under development.

Go to the “org chart” module to view all the policies assigned to any function.
Click on the required function to go to the “Policies” tab.
All policies and sections for the employees assigned to the function will be displayed.
You may browse the employee policy training statistics.
A section is used for selecting policies.
You may classify the documents by topics and by any semantic blocks.
Policies – which policies will be grouped in the section
Access control – to which function the section will be accessed
